account.exportTransactions: Export transactions to downloads folder as CSV file

info.btc-p2pkh: This is a legacy Bitcoin account. It is recommended that you use the Segwit Bitcoin account instead, as it incurs lower network fees.
info.btc-p2wpkh: This Native Segwit Bitcoin account incurs even lower network fees through the bech32 address format. It's bleeding edge technology but not yet widely supported.
info.btc-p2wpkh-p2sh: This is a Segwit Bitcoin account, and is recommended for lower network fees. If you have just upgraded from the previous app, you can find your funds in the Bitcoin Legacy account, which you can enable in the settings. If you want to try cutting edge technology and save even more network fees, go to Settings and enable a Native Segwit Bitcoin account, which uses the Bech32 address format.

accountSummary.exportSummary: Export accounts summary to downloads folder as CSV file
accountSummary.name: Account name
accountSummary.noAccount: There are no accounts to show.
accountSummary.title: Accounts summary

error.xprivEntered: WARNING: You entered an extended private key. Please enter an extended public key and keep your private keys safe.

warning.xpubWrongNet: Warning: The extended public key format indicates that it might not be valid for the selected account type. If you do not see the expected transactions, then try to import the extended public key with another account type.

app.upgrade: A new version of this app is available! Please upgrade from {{current}} to {{version}}.

check.notOK: Backup does NOT match the wallet.
check.title: Check backup

create.alreadyExists: You already have a valid backup. Do you wish to re-create it?
create.info: Please enter the recovery password of the current wallet for verification.
create.title: Create backup
create.verificationFailed: The recovery password does NOT MATCH the current wallet. The backup has been created. Please use 'Check backup' to verify your recovery password again.

backup.insert: Please insert the microSD card to manage backups.
backup.insertButton: I have inserted the microSD card
backup.noBackups: There are no backups on this microSD card.

password.label: Recovery password or hidden recovery password

restore.title: Restore
restore.understand: I understand that an incorrect recovery password will create a different wallet

showMnemonic.description: You will be presented with up to 24 words, which form a backup of your wallet. Write them down on paper. Do not store them digitally or take pictures of it. Do not say the words out loud. This backup is not password-protected. Afterwards, you will be asked to confirm each word.
showMnemonic.title: Show mnemonic seed

backup.title: Manage backups

advanced.label: Advanced settings
advanced.toggleShowFirmwareHash: Show the firmware hash every time on startup

error.e102: The password must consist of at least 4 characters.
error.e112: Hidden device password cannot be the same as the main device password.

bitbox02Interact.confirmDate: Confirm today's date on your BitBox02
bitbox02Interact.confirmDateText: This date will be used to create your backup.
bitbox02Interact.followInstructions: Please follow the instructions on your BitBox02.
bitbox02Interact.followInstructionsMnemonic: Please follow the instructions on your BitBox02 to restore from a mnemonic seed.

mnemonicPassphrase.description: This allows you to enter an optional passphrase after unlocking your BitBox02. NOTE: any passphrase derives a new separate wallet. Keep your passphrase secure. A loss of the passphrase is NOT RECOVERABLE.
mnemonicPassphrase.successEnable: Optional passphrase successfully enabled. From now on you can insert a passphrase after having unlocked your BitBox02. If you don't know what a passphrase is, please deactivate this option. It is an advanced user's option. Warning: every passphrase generates a valid wallet. You need to make sure your passphrase is secure and that you don't lose it. If you lose your passphrase, you will not be able to access your coins. That means your coins will be lost.

bitbox02Wizard.attestationFailed: Device attestation failed, which could be due to restarting the app while the device was waiting for user input. Please reconnect and try again.

backup.point1: Select a backup on the microSD card
backup.point2: Set a password for your device
backup.text1: Great, your BitBox02 password is now set and wallet created. Now it's time to create your first backup. Please make sure your microSD card is inserted into your BitBox02 and continue.
backup.text2: Please follow the on-screen instruction on your device to create a backup.
backup.text3: After your backup is created, please remove the microSD card and store it in a secure location. The contents of the microSD card is not password-protected. Never insert it into any other device but your BitBox02.
backup.userConfirmation1: I should store my backup in a secure location.
backup.userConfirmation2: My backup is not password protected. Anyone with access to it can access my wallet.
backup.userConfirmation3: If I lose or damage my BitBox02, the only way to recover my funds is to restore from my backup.
backup.userConfirmation4: If I lose or damage both my backup and my BitBox02 then my funds will be lost.

create.info: Here are the basics steps you will be taking to set up your BitBox:
create.point2: Set a password for your device
create.text: Ok, let's create a new wallet!

initialize.passwordText: Now let's set a password for your device. Use the controls on your BitBox to enter and choose a password.
initialize.passwordTitle: Set a password for your BitBox
initialize.text: Successfully paired your BitBox02! Now let's initialize your device. Get started by choosing to create a new wallet, or to restore a wallet from an existing backup. Please make sure you have a microSD card inserted in your BitBox02
initialize.tip: We recommend that you proceed in a secure location.
initialize.title: Initialize your BitBox

bitbox02Wizard.insertSDCard: Please make sure you have a microSD card inserted in your BitBox02.
bitbox02Wizard.noPasswordMatch: Passwords did not match, please try again.

pairing.failed: Unconfirmed pairing. Please replug your BitBox02.
pairing.paired: You have confirmed on your device that the code matches. If this is correct, you can continue by clicking the button below.
pairing.title: Verify pairing code
pairing.unpaired: A new BitBox02 has been detected. Please verify that the following code matches what is shown on your device. If the code matches, touch underneath the check mark on your BitBox02 and then click the button below to continue.

restoreFromMnemonic.failed: Restoring from mnemonic seed failed, please try again.

stepBackup.beforeProceed: Before proceeding, please read these important security considerations:
stepBackup.createBackup: You will now create a backup on your microSD card.

stepBackupSuccess.fundsSafe: To keep your funds safe, please remember the following:
stepBackupSuccess.title: Backup Restored!

stepCreate.title: Choose BitBox02 name
stepCreate.toastMicroSD: Please make sure your microSD card is inserted in your BitBox02.

stepCreateSuccess.removeMicroSD: Please remove the microSD card from your BitBox02 and store it in a secure location.

stepInsertSD.insertSDCard: Please insert a microSD card into your BitBox02 to continue.

stepPassword.title: Set BitBox02 password
stepPassword.useControls: Use the controls on your BitBox02 to set a password.

stepUninitialized.create: I want to setup a new BitBox02.
stepUninitialized.restore: I want to restore my wallet from a backup.

stepUnpaired.verify: Please verify the pairing code matches what is shown on your BitBox02.

Hooray! Your BitBox02 is now ready to use. 

For further information on how to use the BitBoxApp, please use the in-app guide by clicking the question mark on the top right corner.
success.title: You're ready to go!

sshAccess.confirm: This setting gives you SSH and sudo access to your BitBoxBase using a system password that you must set. Please proceed only if you know what you are doing.
sshAccess.success: SSH password authentication and sudo access: {{enabled}}
sshAccess.title: SSH access

advanced.title: Advanced settings

backups.confirmBackup: Create a new backup of your BitBoxBase configuration on an external flash drive. Please make sure to insert a flash drive into your BitBoxBase.

Your BitBoxBase will be removed from the App and you will have to reconnect to use it again.

node.title: Node
node.warning: Please allow 1-2 minutes for changes to take effect.

system.confirmRestart: Your BitBoxBase will now restart and will reconnect automatically once ready. This may take several minutes. $t(generic.confirmToContinue)
system.confirmShutdown: Your BitBoxBase will now shut down and you will have to turn it back on manually. $t(generic.confirmToContinue)
system.confirmUpdate: Would you like to update your BitBoxBase from version {{current}} to {{newVersion}}?

system.upToDate: Your BitBoxBase is up to date

updateProgress.warning: When finished, the Base will automatically disconnect and reboot.

bitboxBaseUnlock.placeholder: Enter your BitBoxBase password to unlock

backups.created: Your backup has been created on the USB flashdrive.
backups.finalizing: The BitBoxBase is now finalizing the setup. This only takes a few seconds.
backups.insert: Insert a USB memory stick into the BitBoxBase to make a backup of your wallet.

list.point2: It allows you to reset the BitBoxBase management password.
list.point3: Please remove the flashdrive now and store it in a secure location.

presyncInfo.con2: No independent validation of Bitcoin transaction history
presyncInfo.label: The quickest way to get started
presyncInfo.pro2: No initial download or verification necessary

reindexInfo.con1: Takes about 1 day for the BitBoxBase to be ready

hostname.label: Hostname
hostname.title: Choose a name
hostname.tooltip: Valid hostname is between 2-64 characters; lowercase a-z; digits 0-9; and periods or hypens, excluding first and last characters

clearnet.con1: Leaks home IP address and geolocation if used without precautions
clearnet.label: Use clearnet for all connections; not recommended.

clearnetThenTor.label: Use clearnet for initial block download (IBD), then switch to Tor
clearnetThenTor.pro2: Does not burden the Tor network during IBD

tor.label1: Use Tor for all connections; our recommended option.

device.appUpradeRequired: Your BitBox is not compatible with this desktop application. Please download and install the latest version.

deviceLock.condition3: 2FA DISABLES backups and mobile app pairing. The device must be RESET to exit 2FA!
deviceLock.title: Enable two factor authorization (2FA)

firmware.title: Firmware
firmware.upToDate: Your device is up to date

deviceTampered: Has your BitBox been supplied with a recovery password? If so, stop the setup process and contact support immediately. Shift will never give you a ready made wallet or make password recommendations.
genericError: An error occurred. If you notice any issues, please restart the application.

buttons.restore: Restore a wallet from a backup

goal.paragraph: Please select one of the following options:

accountDescription.text: Your account overview shows your available balance as well as incoming and outgoing transactions. Our guide in ‘Settings’ has more information about each account type.
accountDescription.title: What does this page show me?

accountFiat.text: Yes. Click on any ticker to rotate through fiat currencies. You can change the list of currencies in the settings.
accountFiat.title: Can I display other conversion rates?

accountIncomingBalance.text: Incoming sums up the amounts transferred to you but not yet confirmed by the network.
accountIncomingBalance.title: What does incoming mean?

xpub.text:
An extended public key is a root key from which all receiving addresses of an account are derived.
It is provided here for advanced use and interoperability with watch-only wallets, such as Electrum or Sentinel.
xpub.title: What is an extended public key?

accountLegacyConvert.text: Go to the Bitcoin account, select receive and copy the address. Go back to your legacy account, click send, paste the copied address and tick send all. Then sign and send to move all your coins in a single transaction.
accountLegacyConvert.title: How can I move my coins out of the Legacy account?

accountRates.text: We update exchange rates every minute from CryptoCompare. www.cryptocompare.com
accountRates.title: Which exchange rates apply?

accountReload.text: There’s no need. Your transaction information is updated automatically.
accountReload.title: Can I reload the transaction history?

accountSendDisabled.text: The ‘Send’ button is activated when your balance is more than zero.
accountSendDisabled.title: Why can't I send any {{unit}}?

accountTransactionAttributesBTC.text:
Virtual size: Determines the network fee. You successfully saved on fees if it is smaller than the transaction size.
Size: Actual transaction size in bytes when serialized according to the underlying blockchain.
Weight: A new metric introduced with Segwit to evaluate transaction and block sizes. Each segregated witness byte counts as one, everything else as four weight units. Instead of one megabyte in actual size, the block size limit is now four million weight units.
accountTransactionAttributesBTC.title: What about the Bitcoin-specific transaction details?

accountTransactionAttributesGeneric.text:
Confirmations: Your first transaction broadcast is unconfirmed until a miner includes it in a block, after which it has one confirmation. Each block broadcast on the network adds another confirmation to your transaction. Generally merchants and other network actors will only settle transactions with between three to six confirmations.
Transaction ID: A unique identification number that allows you to look up a transaction in a block explorer.
Fee: Miners are paid a transaction fee as an incentive to include transactions in the blocks they mine. To learn more, click on the send button.
accountTransactionAttributesGeneric.title: What’s the information in the transaction details?

accountTransactionConfirmation.text: A transaction broadcast to the network but not yet confirmed.
accountTransactionConfirmation.title: What is a pending transaction?

accountTransactionLabel.text: It’s the address you received coins from or sent coins to.
accountTransactionLabel.title: Which address is displayed for each transaction?

check.text: 'Check backup' allows you to verify that you have a working backup corresponding to your current wallet. It can also be used to verify that you still have the correct recovery password. You can check your main recovery password or your hidden recovery password.
check.title: What is 'Check backup'?

encrypt.text: No but your recovery password is required to derive the wallet from the stored seed.
encrypt.title: Can I encrypt the backup?

howOften.text:
The backup is automatically generated when a new wallet is created. You only have to make a new backup if your microSD card is lost or damaged, or if you want to use multiple microSD cards as backups.
You do not need to create new backups after transaction activity. All your transaction data can be recreated by your single backup that was automatically generated for you.
howOften.title: How often do I have to make a backup?

whatIsABackup.text: It is a copy of the seed on an microSD card. The seed together with your recovery password generates your wallet.
whatIsABackup.title: What is a backup?

check.text: 'Check backup' allows you to verify that you have a working backup corresponding to your current wallet.
check.title: What is 'Check backup'?

encrypt.text: No. Please keep the microSD card safe, as it contains the unencrypted seed to recover your wallet. If you wish to password-protect your seed, you can enable an optional passphrase in the expert settings under "Manage device".
encrypt.title: Can I encrypt the backup?

whatIsABackup.text: It is a copy of the seed on an microSD card.
whatIsABackup.title: What is a backup?

2FA.text:
When 2FA is enabled, all transactions have to be approved on the paired mobile phone in order to spend coins. Under the hood, an encrypted single-use number is sent to the mobile app, decrypted there, and returned to the BitBox when pressing the Accept button. This communication with the device is done via the channel between the mobile phone and this desktop app established during pairing.

Be sure to backup your wallet and pair the mobile app before enabling 2FA. Once enabled, the micro SD slot and mobile app pairing are disabled. They can be re-enabled by resetting the BitBox, which erases the device.
2FA.title: How does Two factor authorization (2FA) work?

disable2FA.text: In order to disable 2FA, you need to reset your BitBox and then restore the wallet from its backup. Make sure that you still have the microSD card with the backup and that you still remember the recovery password. Then press 'Reset device'. Set a new device password and choose 'Or restore a backup'. Select the backup you have made from the wallet, click 'Restore' and enter the recovery password you used when creating the wallet.
disable2FA.title: How can I disable two factor authorization (2FA)?

ejectBitbox.text: You can unplug the BitBox at any time without having to eject it first.
ejectBitbox.title: How can I eject the BitBox?

ejectSD.text: You can remove the microSD card from the BitBox at any time as long as you are not in the process of creating or restoring a backup.
ejectSD.title: How can I eject the microSD card?

hiddenWallet.text: It is a second wallet on the same device protected by a different device password and recovery password, which you can use for plausible deniability. The same backup seed is used for both your normal and hidden wallet, so no additional backup is required.
hiddenWallet.title: What is a hidden wallet?

legacyHiddenWallet.text: First click the button below (available if the BitBox is unlocked with the main device password and 2FA is disabled), then replug your Bitbox and unlock it with your hidden device password.
legacyHiddenWallet.title: How do I access the legacy hidden wallet?

pairing.text: After having downloaded our mobile app for either iOS or Android, you scan the displayed QR code, which sets up a secure channel between the mobile app and this application. Once scanned, follow the instructions in the mobile app.
pairing.title: How to securely pair with your phone

support.text: Please direct your support requests directly to Safello.
support.title: I experienced an issue with Safello

commission.text: This page uses affiliate links where available. However, not all listed exchanges have an affiliate program. Whether an exchange offers one does not influence our decision to list them.
commission.title: Do you get a commission when I buy Bitcoin at one of these services?

description.text:
This page shows you a selection of our favourite places to buy Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.
At the top of the page you can choose your region and your desired payment method to filter the options.
description.title: What can I see on this page?

whichService.text:
That depends on your location and your needs.
First select your region and then choose your preferred suitable payment method.
Bank transfer: for larger orders.
Credit Card: for smaller and faster orders. However, fees are higher than other methods.
Recurring: automatically buy coins every week/month.
Crypto Swap: exchange one cryptocurrency for another.
Peer to Peer: buy coins more privately directly from another person.
whichService.title: Which service should I use?

address.text: You can give the address to others to send you some coins. Just make sure you are sending to the correct address.
address.title: What do I do with an address?

addressChange.text: As soon as you transact, a new address is automatically added to the list so there are always 20 addresses available which have never received any coins.
addressChange.title: When do the addresses change?

howVerify.text:
For the BitBox01, click on the BitBox icon in the sidebar on the left and see the Pairing section. The guide will update and you can continue following the instructions from there.
For the BitBox02, you can verify addresses directly on the device during the send/receive process.
howVerify.title: How can I verify an address securely?

why20.text: During start-up the app generates addresses derived from your seed to see if they have received funds. As the app can generate an almost infinite number of addresses, it could spend years determining the balance. To limit this search it stops after it sees 20 addresses that have never received funds. This is the "gap limit" and 20 is a de-facto standard though the number is arbitrary. These are the 20 addresses you can choose from.
why20.title: Why only 20 addresses?

whyMany.text: To maintain privacy and security, never hand out the same address twice. If you have used an address, click on on the right arrow for a new address. You can generate up to 20 addresses at a time. Think of addresses like invoice numbers. All addresses are derived from your single backup seed.
whyMany.title: Why so many addresses?

whyVerify.text: You shouldn’t trust your computer to generate and display authentic addresses. It’s big attack surface makes it significantly more vulnerable than a hardware wallet. For the BitBox01, The button to verify the address securely sends the address to a paired mobile phone, from which you can also scan and verify the QR code. For the BitBox02, the address can be verified directly on the BitBox02 display.
whyVerify.title: Why should I verify the address securely?

fee.text:
The fee is based on the transaction data size and not its amount. The fee targets are calculated by Bitcoin Core's fee estimation algorithm for each network priority you chose. They are shown if they have a different value from the target below.
Economy: 24 blocks (around 4 hours for Bitcoin, 1 hour for Litecoin)
Low: 12 blocks (around 2 hours for Bitcoin, 30 minutes for Litecoin)
Normal: 6 blocks (around 1 hour for Bitcoin, 15 minutes for Litecoin)
High: 2 blocks (around 20 minutes for Bitcoin, 5 minutes for Litecoin)
(A block takes on average ten minutes for Bitcoin (2.5 minutes in Litecoin) to mine and the network load may vary considerably in the above periods.)
fee.title: How is the fee determined?

priority.text: The higher fee you are willing to pay, the faster your transaction is typically confirmed by the network.
priority.title: What is the network priority?

revert.text:
Once a transaction is signed and sent (i.e. broadcasted to the network), it can no longer be reverted. Verify the transactions (including the fee) properly before signing!
If you know the recipient and he or she is willing to send the same amount (minus the transaction fees) back to you, you can send them a new receiving address.
revert.title: Can I revert a transaction?

whyFee.text:
Transactions are competing to be confirmed by a miner. Miners choose transactions to be included in the blockchain based on their fee.
Miners vote on the history of transactions. Since there is no trusted third party to enforce one vote per person (which is the whole point of blockchains), miners vote on transactions by sacrificing a costly resource like computing power. As a reward for their work, they can claim newly created coins and the fee of all the transactions they included.
whyFee.title: Why is there a network fee?

what.text: It is possible to power your wallet with your own full nodes instead of using Shift servers.
what.title: What is this?

whenTCP.text: It is advisable to always use TLS, even if your node is running on the same machine as this app. When connecting to a tor hidden service, TLS may be skipped.
whenTCP.title: Should I use TLS?

btc-p2pkh.text: An account that uses an old transaction format, now superseded by the Segwit address and transaction formats. If you used the BitBox with the old desktop app then this account will contain your coins. We recommend transferring your coins to a Bitcoin or Bitcoin bech32 account to save transaction fees.
btc-p2pkh.title: What is Bitcoin Legacy?

btc-p2sh.text: This is a backwards compatible segwit account (p2sh-p2wpkh). It uses a new transaction format that saves you network fees. The address format is similar to legacy, and as such can be used with all existing Bitcoin wallets/exchanges/services.
btc-p2sh.title: What is the Bitcoin account?

btc-p2wpkh.text: Use the new Bitcoin bech32 address format to reap the full benefits of segwit's cheaper network fees. Remember that this format is not accepted everywhere yet.
btc-p2wpkh.title: What is Bitcoin bech32?

moreCoins.text: We will be integrating more altcoins besides Litecoin in the next few releases. If you are looking for a specific coin, leave us a suggestion at the contact below.
moreCoins.title: Can you add more coins?

servers.text:
This app communicates with the Shift Crypto servers to check for updates, load transactions, and send information to paired mobile apps.
The app also retrieves the latest exchange rates from CryptoCompare. All conversions are calculated locally which means no data about the amount of your transaction is ever transmitted.
Note: For Ethereum and ERC20 Tokens, we use Etherscan.io APIs.
servers.title: Which servers does this app talk to?

whyMultipleAccounts.text: Some cryptocurrencies have multiple address and transaction formats. These addresses are separated into extra accounts.
whyMultipleAccounts.title: Why are there multiple accounts for the same coin?

forgotDevicePassword.text: You have to reset the device and restore the wallet from a backup, using the recovery password.
forgotDevicePassword.title: What do I do if I forgot the device password?

reset.text: Enter a wrong device password 15 times. The last few attempts require a long touch on the device.
reset.title: How do I reset the device?

deviceNotRecognized.text: The device should blink once when inserted. Make sure that it is inserted the right way around. If you are having trouble, please contact us through the link below.
deviceNotRecognized.title: My BitBox01 is not recognized

getDevice.text: You can buy a BitBox in our online shop:
getDevice.title: How can I get a device?

internet.text: Yes, an internet connection is required to synchronize the wallet, send transactions and retrieve the latest exchange rates.
internet.title: Does this app require an internet connection?

lostDevice.text: You can recover your accounts on a new BitBox or with our backup center.
lostDevice.title: I lost my device. Now what?

useWithoutDevice.text: Unfortunately, this is not yet possible at the moment.
useWithoutDevice.title: Can I use the app without a device?

welcome.text: Thanks for using this app built by Shift Crypto in Switzerland. We appreciate any input you have to share. Please give feedback using the link at the bottom.
welcome.title: Welcome to the BitBoxApp!

hiddenWallet.info1HTML: For plausible deniability purposes, a hidden wallet can be created based on a different device password + recovery password combination.
hiddenWallet.info2HTML: Define the device password and recovery password you want to associate with your hidden wallet below. The device password and recovery password must be different from the ones you defined for your primary wallet.
hiddenWallet.success: Hidden wallet created successfully. Replug your BitBox to unlock it.

error.e102: The device password must consist of at least 4 characters.

info.description1: Choose your device password. This will be used to unlock your BitBox.
info.description2: You can use numbers, letters & symbols. Longer passwords offer higher security.
info.description3: If you lose the device password you will have to reset your device and restore your wallet backup.
info.subtitle: Now you will set your device password
info.title: Initializing your device

legacyhiddenwallet.successDisable: Successfully disabled the legacy hidden wallet.
legacyhiddenwallet.successEnable: Successfully enabled the legacy hidden wallet. Replug your BitBox and enter the hidden device password to access the legacy hidden wallet.

mobile.usingMobileDataWarning: Mobile data usage: this app may download up to a few hundred megabytes of blockchain header data after unlocking an account. Please connect to Wi-Fi to avoid using mobile data. After dismissing it, this message won't be shown again.

aborted.text: The pairing has been aborted from the mobile app.
aborted.title: Aborted

pairing.confirm: Are you sure you want to pair your BitBox? Note that after, the mobile phone is required to perform a transaction.

connectOnly.title: Scan with our mobile app by selecting the menu item 'Connect to new desktop app'

error.text: Something went wrong. Please start again.
error.title: Error

pullFailed.text: Failed to pull a message from your mobile through the relay server. The relay server might be offline, please contact support.
pullFailed.title: Pull failed

scanningFailed.text: Mobile was not able to scan the message successfully. Please try again.
scanningFailed.title: Scanning Failed

start.step1: If you do not have the mobile app, you can scan the QR code for the Apple App Store or the Google Play Store depending on which phone you have.
start.step2: Scan with our mobile app, which you can find under the name 'Digital Bitbox 2FA' in the app stores for iOS and Android:

started.text: Now please follow the instructions in the mobile app.
started.title: Great

success.text: Congratulations, you successfully paired your BitBox with the mobile app!
success.title: Success

timeout.text: The pairing timed out after two minutes. Start again if you still want to pair the mobile app.
timeout.title: Timeout

pairing.title: Mobile pairing

random.description: Your BitBox generated the following {{bits}}-bit random number:

receive.label: Your address

onlyThisCoin.description: To receive other tokens, enable them in the settings. If you deposit other tokens, they might not be accessible.
onlyThisCoin.warning: Make sure to only receive {{accountName}} on this address.

receive.showFull: Show and verify full address on device
receive.title: Get {{accountName}}
receive.verifyInstruction: Please verify that the following address matches the one displayed on your device.

warning.secureOutput: Please pair your BitBox with your mobile device to enable secure address verification. Go to 'Manage device' in the sidebar.

reset.description: All data on the device will be deleted. That includes your Private Key!
reset.title: Factory reset device
reset.understand: I have a backup and know my recovery password

create.description1: We recommend you set up your device in a safe environment, meaning you are away from other people that could see what password you choose.
create.description2: You will be asked to create two passwords.
create.description3: The first is the device password which unlocks your BitBox device and can be changed later.
create.description4: The second is the recovery password which unlocks your wallet. This password cannot be changed later.
create.description5: The wallet you create will be backed up to a file on the microSD card provided. This can be used in an emergency to recover your funds using your recovery password.
create.title: Security information

restore.description1: You will be asked to insert the microSD card you used to store you backup.
restore.description2: To restore your device you will need your recovery password.
restore.description3: Please take care when entering the recovery password. Any password you enter will create a valid wallet. If you enter the wrong password you may be shown a wallet balance that you do not expect.
restore.title: Security information

agreements.funds-access: I will NOT be able to access my funds if I forget my recovery password
agreements.password-change: I can NOT change the recovery password later
agreements.password-required: The recovery password is required to restore a wallet from a backup

error.e102: The password must consist of at least 4 characters.
error.e200: You need to insert a microSD card into your BitBox in order to create a wallet, so a backup can be created automatically.

info.description1: Insert the microSD card into the BitBox
info.description2: Choose a recovery password for the wallet and select “Set recovery password now”
info.description3: The back up to microSD card and your recovery password is the only method to recover your funds in case of lost or stolen BitBox device.
info.description4: You cannot change your recovery password later on without transferring your funds.
info.title: Create a new wallet

error.e200: Restoring a wallet from a backup requires the microSD card.

info.description1: Insert the microSD card into the BitBox and click “Continue”
info.description4: You need to confirm to understand that an incorrect password will create a different wallet.
info.title: How to restore a wallet from a backup

description.economy: 24 blocks (around 4 hours for Bitcoin, 1 hour for Litecoin)
description.high: 2 blocks (around 20 minutes for Bitcoin, 5 minutes for Litecoin)
description.low: 12 blocks (around 2 hours for Bitcoin, 30 minutes for Litecoin)
description.normal: 6 blocks (around 1 hour for Bitcoin, 15 minutes for Litecoin)

signprogress.description: This is a transaction containing a lot of data. To fully sign the transaction, you will be asked to confirm {{steps}} times.
signprogress.label: Progress

send.success: The transaction has been signed and sent.
send.title: Send {{accountName}}

electrum.resetConfirm: Do you want to remove all servers and install the default servers?
electrum.step2-text: Enter a certificate of the server's certificate chain. Alternatively, download the remote certificate and compare it visually.
electrum.step2-text-tcp: You can skip this step if you do not want to use TLS.
electrum.step3-text: Check the connection and add the server.
electrum.step4-text: Restart the wallet. If you do not remove the default servers, your own node will be added as a redundancy.

settings.restart: Please re-start the BitBoxApp for the changes to take effect.
settings.success: Please unplug and replug the BitBox for the changes to take effect.
settings.title: Settings

create.info1: Your wallet has been securely backed up to the microSD Card. Remove it and keep it safe.
create.info2: You have created a secure device password that unlocks the BitBox.
create.info3: You have created a secure recovery password for your wallet that unlocks your funds and restores your backups.
create.summary: Here is a summary of what you have done
create.title: Success

restore.summary: You have successfully restored a wallet from your backup.
restore.title: Success

unlock.description: Enter your device password to unlock your device.

error.e109_normal: Wrong device password. {{remainingAttempts}} attempts remain before the device is reset.
error.e109_touch: $t(unlock.error.e109_normal) The next login requires holding the touch button.
error.e113: Due to many login attempts, the next login requires holding the touch button for 4 seconds.

input.label: Device password
input.placeholder: Enter your device password to unlock the device

upgradeFirmware.description: Do you want to upgrade the firmware from version {{currentVersion}} to {{newVersion}}?
upgradeFirmware.label: Your BitBox requires a firmware upgrade.
upgradeFirmware.locked: To upgrade from {{currentVersion}} to {{newVersion}}, please do a long touch.
upgradeFirmware.title: Upgrade firmware
upgradeFirmware.unlocked: The bootloader is unlocked. To continue, please:
upgradeFirmware.unlocked2: The LED will light up when your BitBox is plugged back in
upgradeFirmware.unlocked3: Tap the touch button when the LED lights up

warning.receivePairing: Please pair the BitBox to enable secure address verification. Go to 'Manage device' in the sidebar.
warning.sdcard: Keep the microSD card stored separate from the BitBox, unless you want to manage backups.
warning.sendPairing: Please pair the BitBox to securely verify transaction details. Go to 'Manage device' in the sidebar.

welcome.insertBitBox02: For the BitBox02, please tap the device to continue.
welcome.insertDevice: Please connect your device to get started
welcome.title: Welcome
